creator: vejpuste@oikt.czu.cz
text:
Created attachment 22741
Configs 2.2.9 and 2.2.10

Hello.
I try compile Apache 2.2.10 on Red Hat Enterprise Linux ES release 4 (Nahant Update 7)
configure fail with error Error, SSL/TLS libraries were missing or unusable.
When I try configure 2.2.9 working OK.
Logs are in attachement.
ld -v
GNU ld version 2.15.92.0.2 20040927
configure in 2.2.9 add -ldl to LIBS.
Regards
Libor Vejpustek

Created attachment 22826
Patch against trunk

Can you please check if the attached patch fixes your issue? Keep in mind that you need to execute the buildconf script after applying the patch.
creator: rpluem@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 22835
Patch against trunk

The first patch was not correct and breaks the build in other ways. Here is a revised version.
creator: rpluem@apache.org
vejpuste@oikt.czu.cz
text:
I try patch acinclude.m4 and compile again.
Result is bad :
OK
  forcing SSL_LIBS to "-lssl -lcrypto"
  adding "-lssl" to LIBS
  adding "-lcrypto" to LIBS
checking openssl/engine.h usability... yes
checking openssl/engine.h presence... yes
checking for openssl/engine.h... yes
checking for SSLeay_version... yes
checking for SSL_CTX_new... no
checking for ENGINE_init... yes
checking for ENGINE_load_builtin_engines... no
checking for SSL_set_cert_store... no
configure: error: ... Error, SSL/TLS libraries were missing or unusable

Only set "export LIBS=-ldl" before config working OK and Apache is compiled and working. But it's not right solution.
Regards,
Libor Vejpustek

(In reply to comment #3)
> I try patch acinclude.m4 and compile again.
> Result is bad :
> OK
>   forcing SSL_LIBS to "-lssl -lcrypto"
>   adding "-lssl" to LIBS
>   adding "-lcrypto" to LIBS
> checking openssl/engine.h usability... yes
> checking openssl/engine.h presence... yes
> checking for openssl/engine.h... yes
> checking for SSLeay_version... yes
> checking for SSL_CTX_new... no
> checking for ENGINE_init... yes
> checking for ENGINE_load_builtin_engines... no
> checking for SSL_set_cert_store... no
> configure: error: ... Error, SSL/TLS libraries were missing or unusable
> 
> Only set "export LIBS=-ldl" before config working OK and Apache is compiled and
> working. But it's not right solution.
> Regards,
> Libor Vejpustek
> 

Did you execute ./buildconf after applying the patch? Your output shows that the patch is not used.
creator: rpluem@apache.org

text:
Hello,
Sorry I'm not experienced tester.
After ./buildconf configure working OK and make finished OK too.
Thanks
Libor Vejpustek
creator: vejpuste@oikt.czu.cz

text: *** Bug 46372 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de

text:
I download the acinclude.m4 and run ./buildconf

However, the error occurs as follows:
found apr source: srclib/apr
found apr-util source: srclib/apr-util
rebuilding srclib/apr/configure
buildconf: checking installation...
buildconf: python version 1.5.2 (ok)
buildconf: autoconf version 2.13 found.
           You need autoconf version 2.50 or newer installed
           to build APR from SVN.
./buildconf failed for ap

On the otherhand: the configure command can be finished by the following command:
LIBS=-ldl ./configure --prefix=/export/home05/apache2210 --disable-status --disable-charset-lite --enable-so --enable-mods-shared='deflate rewrite' --enable-ssl --with-ssl=/export/home05/openssl098h --enable-unique-id

Is it harm to the apache? Please advise
creator: ryanlau@mtr.com.hk
rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text:
As I noted in Bug 46372 you can apply a 2 line patch directly to configure. No need to rebuild configure with buildconf.

If you want to give the newest version a try, you can download the not yet released 2.2.11 httpd, which contains the final patch at http://httpd.apache.org/dev/dist Remember: this is not yet an official release and if the voting fails, it might never be one.

If you definitely want to rebuild configure for 2.2.10, then you should first retrieve all the tools necessary.

creator: skrishnamur1@bloomberg.net
text: Hi, Im running into the exact same issue with apache 2.2.9 and due to certain constraints cant upgrade to apapche 2.2.10. I tried applying this patch using patch -s < patch.file but get the error "1 out of 1 hunks failed:saving rejects to acinclude.m4.rej" could someone tell me how this patch is to be applied. Also I cant seemt o find any references to  ap_ssltk_libs in the httpd.2.2.9 config file or acinclude.m4 files etc ...only references to ap_ssltk_lib. I also tried setting the LIBS as export LIBS=-ldl and re-running configure but I still get the same error. am on slightly tight timelines here, so would appreciate the help. This is on solaris 9. thx

creator: rpluem@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #13)
> Hi, Im running into the exact same issue with apache 2.2.9 and due to certain

2.2.9 does not have this issue. It was a regression in 2.2.10. So your problem seems to be caused by something different. Please open a new report about this problem.
